result.rationale: The Angola Sparklewing has only been recorded at 4 locations, which are spread over the range of the Planalto do Bié and the neighbouring Serra da Chela. The species seems to be restricted to these mountain ranges. All records are old (1932, 1933, 1951, 1973) and outside protected area. Three of the four old localities has not been surveyed since. From Tundavala we have few recent records. Hence the species seems present and might be more widespread. The current area of Occupancy is 16 km² and the Extent of occurrence 60,931 km². Since the region is not well surveyed the AOO km² might be larger, but some population might have also gone extinct due to the ongoing intensification of agriculture and the mining activities all over Angola. The habitat is further inferred to be under threat due to deforestation. The species is listed as Vulnerable.

Collections from 1932 and 1933; and Pinhey (1975); collection year unknown. The species has not been recorded since, however the area is under-surveyed.
result.habitat: Shady mountain streams, inferred from the general ecology of the genus.
result.threats:
Current threats are unknown. However, it is inferred to be threatened by deforestation.

In Angola, the area of the only known collections has seen the fastest human population growth, and clear cutting is evident here.
result.conservationmeasures: Protection of montane forests is needed. Research into population numbers and range, biology and ecology, habitat status, threats, conservation measures, and trends/monitoring of this species would be valuable.
